title: Tatale/Sanguli elects a Presiding Member
text:
Politics | 22 October 2015 17:00 CET Tatale/Sanguli elects a Presiding Member By GNA 
Tatale (N/R), Oct. 22 GNA - The Tatale-Sanguli District Assembly has elected Mr Frank Kibikal Wumborja Nyimangnun, Assembly member for the Tatindo electoral area as the Presiding Member (PM) of the assembly to steer affairs for the next four years. 
Mr Nyimangnun polled 23 votes after his contender, Mr Samuel Sagbe, Assembly Member for the Nakpali-Borile electoral area stepped down after the first round of voting. 
The Assembly failed to elect a Presiding Member during the inauguration of the assembly earlier this month, which compelled the assembly to call for an emergency meeting on October 21, 2015 for the election. 
During the first round of voting, out of the 28 Assembly members who voted, Mr Frank Kibikal Wumborja Nyimangnun polled 15 votes and his contender Mr Samuel Sagbe had 12 votes, which could not give any of them the two thirds required to occupy the position. 
Mr Samuel Sagbe had to step down for Mr Frank Kibikal, who polled 23 votes out of the 28 votes cast to be confirmed as the presiding member whiles five persons voted against him. 
Mr Francis Opoku, Tatale/Sanguli Electoral Officer conducted and supervised the election. 
Mr Frank Kibikal expressed gratitude to the assembly and called on all to support him to carry the agenda of the assembly forward. 
He said the main aim of the assembly should be focused on improved revenue generation to embark on development projects to improve the living standards of the people. 
Mr Nicholas Waake, District Chief Executive (DCE) for the Tatale-Sangule District commended the assembly members for their cooperation in electing a Presiding Member and advised them to work in unity. 
He advised the assembly members to educate their people and volunteer information for the arrest of criminals in the area, especially armed robbers, who attack traders on the Tatale-Yendi road. 
GNA
